turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: We go for a walk.

turns.speaker: SPUD
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: A walk.

turns.speaker: SPUD
turns.text: But where?

turns.speaker: TOMMY
turns.text: Well, what are you waiting for?

turns.speaker: SPUD
turns.text: I don't know, Tommy. I don't know if it's... normal.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: What do you see as your main strengths?

turns.speaker: SPUD
turns.text: I love people. All people. Even people that no one else loves, I think they're OK, you know. Like Beggars.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Homeless people?

turns.speaker: SPUD
turns.text: No, not homeless people. Beggars, Francis Begbie -- one of my mates. I wouldn't say my best mate, I mean, sometimes the boy goes over the score, like one time when we -- me and him -- were having a laugh and all of a sudden he's fucking gubbed me in the face, right --

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Mr. Murphy, {leaving your friend aside,} do you see yourself as having any weaknesses?

turns.speaker: SPUD
turns.text: No. Well, yes. I have to admit it: I'm a perfectionist. For me, it's the best or nothing at all. If things go badly, I can't be bothered, but I have a good feeling about this interview. Seems to me like it's gone pretty well. We've touched on a lot of subjects, a lot of things to think about, for all of us.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Qual se tu?

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: It is I.  The journey you undertook to reach me could not have been an easy one.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: It was not. The Barrier stood between us - but we breached it.

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: Magnificent. You are the first to find me.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: We sought only your infinite wisdom.

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: And how did you breach the Barrier?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: With a starship!

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: This starship, could it carry my wisdom beyond the Barrier?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: It could. Yes.

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: Then I shall make use of this starship.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: It will be your chariot!

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: He has his doubts...

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: You doubt me?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Why? Why have you done this to my friend?

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: He doubts me.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: No, no, it's not possible.

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: Bring me the ship or I will destroy you!

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: The ship....

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: Bring it closer so that I might join with it. Do it, or watch these puny things die horribly.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I couldn't help but notice you pain.

turns.speaker: BEING
turns.text: My pain?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: It runs deep. Share it with me.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Bad news, gentlemen. Shore leave's been cancelled.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Rescued at last.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Return to prearranged coordinates for pickup.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Don't tell them you're lost. You'll never live it down.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Is there a problem, gentlemen?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: My visual says sunny skies and seventy degrees.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Sulu! Look! The sun's come out! It's a miracle!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Don't worry, fellas. Your secret's` safe with me. I'll send the shuttlecraft to pick you up.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Admit it. We're lost.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: All right, we're lost.  But we're making good time.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Um... yes. We've been caught in a blizzard!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: And we can't see a thing. Request you direct us to the coordinates.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Sulu, what are you doing?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Plotting our new course.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: New course? You have no authority.  What's going on here?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Pavel.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Following new course. Warp seven.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Estimating destination in 6.7 hours, present speed.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: In firing position. Torpedo armed.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: But, Captain, we're firing directly on your position.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Shuttle en route.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Position, Bird of Prey?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Closing.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Mr. Chekov, I've lost the Bird of Prey. She must have cloaked.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Raise shields.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: But the shuttle-

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: DO it. Go to Red Alert.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: What's Emergency Landing Plan B?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I don't have a clue.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV'S IMAGE
turns.text: This is the Starship Enterprise.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: A Federation starship.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV'S IMAGE
turns.text: This is Captain Pavel Chekov speaking. You are in violation of Neutral Zone Treaty. I advise you to release your hostages at once or suffer the consequences.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Your threats amuse me, Captain Chekov. What consequences did you have in mind?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV'S IMAGE
turns.text: You are a master of understatement. They are likely to destroy the planet.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Then it's fortunate that I have you and your starship to protect me. In the meantime, Captain Chekov, I instruct you and your First Officer to beam down to my coordinates.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV'S IMAGE
turns.text: We will be happy to beam down. But first we must have certain assurances.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV'S IMAGE
turns.text: I instruct you to surrender. You are under attack by Federation forces.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Do you realize what you've done? It wasn't bloodshed I wanted.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Can we have it quiet?

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: Enterprise, this is Starfleet Operations. Come in.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bob?

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: Jim...? Well, we're dressing informally, aren't we?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You caught me on my way to the shower.

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: I apologize for canceling shore leave, but look, we have a dangerous situation out on Nimbus III.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On "The Planet Of Galactic Peace?"

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: The same. From what we can make out, a terrorist force has captured the only settlement. And they've taken hostages.

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: The Klingon, the Romulan, the Federation consuls. Now I know Enterprise is not exactly up to specs...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: With all due respect, the Enterprise is a disaster. There must be other ships in the quadrant.

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: Other ships, yes. But no experienced commanders. Captain, I need Jim Kirk.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh, please.

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: Your orders are to proceed to Nimbus III, assess the situation and avoid a confrontation if possible. Above all, however, get those hostages back safely.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Have the Klingons responded?

turns.speaker: COMMANDERS IMAGE
turns.text: No, but you can bet they will.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Understood. Kirk out.

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: Besides, I can't believe you'd kill me for a field of empty holes.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: It's all I have.

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: Your pain runs deep.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: What do you know of my pain?

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: Let us explore it together.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: Where did you get this power?

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: The power was within you.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: I feel as if a weight has been lifted from my heart. How can I repay you for this miracle?

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: Join my quest.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: What is it you seek?

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: What you seek. What all men have sought since time began - ultimate knowledge. But to find it we'll need a starship.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: A starship? There are no starships on Nimbus III.

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: Perhaps I have a way to bring one here.

turns.speaker: J'ONN
turns.text: But how?

turns.speaker: RIDER
turns.text: Have faith, my friend. There are more of us than you know.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You told me you could have the ship operational  in two weeks. I gave you three. What Happened?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I think you gave me too much time, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Very well, Mr. Scott. Carry on.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye, Captain  How many times do I have to tell you? The right tool for the right job...

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Don't you worry, Captain. We'll beat those Klingon devils even if I have to get out and push.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I hope it won't come to that, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Scotty here, Captain. Transporter is still inoperative. Even if we could lock onto the hostages, we couldn't beam them up.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then we'll have to get them out the old fashioned way.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Captain, we can't trust anyone now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If we could send a distress signal...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, get the transporter working. If we contact a rescue ship we'll need it.  Which way to the turbo shaft?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Head down that tunnel to the hydro vent and turn right. Then left at the blowscreen. You can't miss it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, you're amazing.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: She's got partial power, sir. I might be able to take two of you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Beam up Spock and Dr. McCoy. Now!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Mr. Scott apologizes for having to send the shuttlecraft. The transporter beam is non-operational. Captain, we've received important orders from Starlet Command.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why didn't you beep my communicator?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: ER... You forgot to take it with you.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Captain, Starfleet transmission on line.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Put it on the veiwscreen, would You please?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Captain, we're receiving the hostage information you requested.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Put it on the screen.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Standard orbit, Mr. Sulu.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Captain, we're receiving transmission from Paradise City. They're demanding to know our intentions.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Respond with static. Let them think we're having difficulty. Which wouldn't be far from the truth.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Paradise City, can you boost your power? We're barely receiving transmission.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Transporter room. Status.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Bird of Prey bearing one zero five mark two.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Go, Sulu.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock - What are you doing in this neck of the woods?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I'm flattered. Twelve hundred points of interest in Yosemite and you pick me.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I regret to inform you that the record for free-climbing El Captain is in no danger of being broken.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm not trying to break any records. I'm doing this because I enjoy it. Not to mention the most important reason for climbing a mountain...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: And that is?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Because it's there.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Ah, Captain?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: MM.?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I do not think you realize the gravity of your situation.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On the contrary. Gravity is foremost on my mind. Look, I'm trying to make an ascent here. Why don't you go pester Dr McCoy for a while?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe Dr McCoy is not in the best of moods.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Concentration is vital. You must be one with the rock.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, I appreciate your concern, but if you don't stop distracting me, I'm liable to be one...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh, God

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Perhaps "because it is there" is not sufficient reason for climbing a mountain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh, no. It isn't that. I knew I wouldn't die because the two of you were with me.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I've always known... I'll die alone.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am preparing to toast a marsh melon.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Oh. I believe we are required to engage in a ritual known as the singalong.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's great. I haven't sung around a campfire since I was a boy in Iowa. What are we going to sing? What... Bones, what are we going to sing?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: "Pack Up Your Troubles."

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Are we leaving, Captain?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: "Row, row, row your boat..." I love "Row..."  Do - do you know "Row, Row, Row, Row, Row Your Boat?"

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That song did not come up in my research, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The lyrics are - are very simple. It's, er, "Row, row, row your boat, gently down the stream. Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily, life is but a dream.." The Doctor and I will start it off, and then when we give you the signal, you jump in.  Doctor, if you please.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come on, Spock. Why didn't you jump in?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was trying to comprehend the meaning of the words.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, we're on leave. You can call me Jim.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Jim.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes, Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Life is not a dream.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Go to sleep, Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Goodnight, Bones.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Goodnight, Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Goodnight, Doctor.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I could use a shower.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not General Korrd.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The same. He's apparently fallen out of favor with the Klingon High Command.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: General Korrd's military strategies were required learning when I was a cadet at the Academy. When they put me out to pasture, I hope I fare better than Korrd.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is it? You look like you've seen a ghost.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Perhaps I have, Captain. Perhaps I have.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, what is it? Do you know this Vulcan?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I cannot be certain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But he does seem familiar?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: He reminds me of someone I knew in my youth.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I do not often think of the past.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who is it he reminds you of?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There was a young student, exceptionally gifted, possessing of great intelligence. It was assumed that one day he would take his place amongst the great scholars of Vulcan. But he was a revolutionary.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The knowledge and experience he sought were forbidden by Vulcan belief.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: He rejected his logical upbringing and embraced the animal passions of our ancestors.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: He believed the key to self-knowledge was emotion, not logic.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: When he encouraged others to follow him, he was banished from Vulcan, never to return.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Fascinating.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Klingon vessel now entering quadrant. Bird of Prey. Estimating 1.9 hours until her weapons come to bear.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Damn.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Their equipment is primitive but effective. I recommend we land at Coordinate 8563.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That puts us pretty far away from Paradise City.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: To land any closer would risk detection.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu. Execute.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: At footspeed I estimate the journey to Paradise City at 1.2 hours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We don't have 1.2 hours.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes, Captain?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Be one with the horse.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes, Captain.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Exactly 15.5 seconds.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: An eternity during which we'll be vulnerable to Klingon attack. Korrd-you tell him.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You must allow us to act.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Let me do something.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Damnit, Spock. God damnit!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Captain, what have I done -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What you have done is betray every man on this ship.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Worse. I have betrayed you. I do not expect you to forgive me.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Forgive you? I ought to knock you on your goddamn ass!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: If you think it would help.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You stay out of this!  Why, Spock? Why? I.. All you had to do was pull the trigger.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: If I had pulled the trigger, Sybok would be dead.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I ordered you to defend this ship.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You ordered me to kill my brother.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Look, the man may be a fellow Vulcan, but that doesn't...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No, no, no, Captain. You do not understand. Sybok also in a son of Sarek.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You mean he's your brother brother?  You made that up!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I did not.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You did too. Sybok couldn't possibly be your brother because I happen to know for a fact that you don't have a brother.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Technically, you are correct. I do not have a brother.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There, you see? See?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I have a half brother.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I gotta sit down.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Exactly. That is correct. Sybok's mother was a Vulcan princess. Upon her death, Sybok and I were raised as brothers.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why didn't you tell me this before?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was not disposed to discuss... matters of a personal nature. For that, I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He's sorry, See, he's sorry. Everything... that makes everything all right. He's sorry, everything's...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There's got to be a way out of this place.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: This is a new brig, Captain. It is escape-proof.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The designers tested it using the most intelligent and resourceful person they could find. He failed to escape.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: This, er, person... didn't by any chance have pointed ears and an unerring capacity for getting his shipmates into trouble, did he?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: He did have pointed ears.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Is it possible?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Is what possible?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That he's found it. Sha Ka Ree. The reason Sybok left Vulcan.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There Sha Ka Ree is fabled to exist.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But the center of the galaxy can't be reached. No ship has ever gone into the Great Barrier. No probe has ever returned.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Sybok possessed the keenest intellect I have ever known.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock! My only concern is getting the ship back. When that's done and Sybok is in here then you can debate Sha Ka Ree until you're green in the face. Until then, you're either with me or you're not.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I am here, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's a little vague, Spock -

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You're right. I'm a little out of practice.  Uh....that's an "s."

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: A "t."

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: "a"... "n"...uh, "d"... end of word.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: New word. "b".. "a"... um...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There is an emergency sending apparatus in the forward observation room.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The only problem is, it's up there. We're down here.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe I have found a faster way.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hmmm?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Uh-uh.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It would appear we are too heavy.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It must be all those marsh melons.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock... the booster rockets.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: If I activate them now, Captain, we will be propelled upward at an unbelievable rate.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Fire the rockets!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The emergency channel, open.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: To anyone within the sound of my voice: This is Captain James T. Kirk of the Federation Starship Enterprise. If you read me, acknowledge. Acknowledge.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ...mark two.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mark two. Request emergency assistance. Acknowledge.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock... don't.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It's all right, Captain.  Proceed.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is this?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe we are witnessing my birth.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Welcome aboard, Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, I thought I was going to die.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Not possible. You were never alone.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Maybe he's not out there, Bones. Maybe he's right here... in the human heart  Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was thinking of Sybok. I've lost a brother.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes. I lost a brother once. I was lucky. I got him back.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I must have your starship.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You staged all this to get your hands on my ship?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: James T. Kirk, Captain of the Enterprise.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: But I thought Captain Chekov..  I see. Very clever, Captain.  Spock, it would appear that you've been given a second chance to join me. What do you say?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: No! No reply. Remain on course.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Sybok, listen to me. In order for this craft to enter the landing bay, Enterprise must lower the shields and activate the tractor beam. To get us inside and re-raise the shields will take-

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: In order to lower and raise the shields as quickly as possible, we're going to forego the tractor beam and fly her in manually.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: We must change our course at once.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'll take you to the bridge.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I trust your message was received?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You can't expect us to stand by while you take the ship into the Great Barrier.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: What you fear is the unknown. The people of your planet once believed their world was flat. Columbus proved it was round. They said the sound barrier could never be broken. It was broken. They said warp speed could not be achieved. The Great Barrier is the ultimate expression of this universal fear. It's an extension of personal fear.  Captain Kirk, I so much want your understanding. I want your respect. Are you afraid to hear me out?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm afraid of nothing.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Sha Ka Ree. "The Scource." "Heaven." "Eden." call it "Qui'Tu." To the Romulans, it's "Vorta Vor." The Andorian word is.. unpronounceable. Still, every culture shares he common dream of a place from which creation sprang. For us, that place will soon be a reality.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The only realty I see is that I'm a prisoner on my own ship. What is this power you have to control the minds of my crew?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I don't control minds. I free them.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock...  What have you done to my friends?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: I've done nothing. This is who they are. Didn't you know that?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No... I didn't.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Now learn something about yourself.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No. I refuse.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Wait!  You know we'll never make it through the Great Barrier.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: But if we do, will that convince you that my vision was true?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Your vision?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Given to me by God.  He waits for us on the other side.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You are mad!

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Am I? We'll see.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: About the ship...

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: The ship needs its Captain.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No special conditions?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: No conditions.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What makes you think I won't turn us around?

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Because you, too, must know.

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: What have I done?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Kirk to Enterprise. Listen carefully...

turns.speaker: SYBOK
turns.text: Spock...

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Borgus Frat.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: "Let's see what she's got," said the Captain. And then we found out, didn't we?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I know you'll whip her into shape, Scotty. You always do.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Uhura, I thought you were on leave.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: And I thought we were supposed to be going together.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Oh, I cannot leave her now when she needs me the most.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I had a feeling you would say something like that. So I brought us dinner.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: They can't be serious. The ship's in pieces and we've less than a skeleton aboard.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Starfleet, are you aware of our currant status?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Easy, easy,  easy, Scotty. Easy. You're back with us.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Uhura, I had the strangest dream. I dreamt that a madman had taken over the Enterprise.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Scotty, dear, he' not a madman.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: He's not?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: No. Sybok has simply put us in touch with feelings we've always been afraid to express.
